questions.question: Which of the following is true about directive input binding?
options: Inputs must be defined in a component only
Directives can accept input values via @Input bindings
Only built-in directives can use bindings
Directive input values must be constants
questions.answer: Directives can accept input values via @Input bindings

questions.question: What is the key difference between `@Injectable({ providedIn: 'root' })` and `@NgModule.providers`?
options: The latter provides singleton services globally
The former allows tree-shakable global service registration
They are exactly the same in behavior
questions.answer: The former allows tree-shakable global service registration

questions.question: What does Angular's AOT (Ahead-of-Time) compiler do at build time?
options: Compiles HTML templates and TypeScript into efficient JavaScript before browser download
Binds component styles to host elements
questions.answer: Compiles HTML templates and TypeScript into efficient JavaScript before browser download

questions.question: You have a component that displays data from an API. The component loads, but the view doesn't update even after data is fetched. What is a likely cause?

questions.answer: Data fetch ran outside Angular's zone and change detection didn't trigger

questions.question: What is the difference between `ngAfterViewInit` and `ngOnInit`?
options: `ngOnInit` runs after view and content children are initialized
`ngAfterViewInit` runs after view and child components are initialized
They both run at the same time
questions.answer: `ngAfterViewInit` runs after view and child components are initialized

questions.question: You want to manually trigger view updates. What service should you use?

questions.question: You want to intercept all HTTP requests to add an auth token. What should you do?
options: Create an `HttpInterceptor` and provide it in `HTTP_INTERCEPTORS`
